text: Do Header or Text modules support personalization tokens if we copied and pasted them in? Or are we forced to still use Rich Text Modules only?

Rich text modules only for right now. Custom modules with rich text fields probably have the ability to use them. you can only do smart content with HS rich text modules right now. HS Devs have said unofficially in slack they’re considering ways of doing smart content in custom modules
<@U38EZFVFE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U38EZFVFE/F9VETFBF1/screen_shot_2018-03-22_at_11.46.10_am.jpg|Screen Shot 2018-03-22 at 11.46.10 AM.jpg>
<@U38EZFVFE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U38EZFVFE/F9TMYNGU8/screen_shot_2018-03-22_at_11.45.47_am.jpg|Screen Shot 2018-03-22 at 11.45.47 AM.jpg>
anyone know by heart what the hubl is to get the current pages URL parameters? can’t remember where the heck it is in the documentation searched all over
nvm figured it out by guessing

You can use the developer info to find things like this. Click on the little HubSpot logo in the top right on a frontend page and it's under there. Gives you a big JSON dump of all the variables available on that page
Firefox has got a pretty nice UI for sorting through it, for Chrome you probably want a formatting plugin unless they've changed it since I switched to Firefox
yea, I’m aware, I just get too lazy to look there because It’s hard to follow the full path of what I need, there’s just so much data

I have a plugin called json view, makes it so it’s all expandable and whatnot but I can’t tell what branch of the tree I’m in really making it hard

If anyone’s found great plugins for this I’d love to know of some
